metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7223 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The WebExtension APIs in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0 allow remote attackers to gain privileges, and possibly obtain sensitive information or conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
